title: Verify: The WWE Network can be accessed while the Roku is connected wirelessly
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Roku device
AND the Roku device is currently connected to a wireless network
AND the "WWE Network" channel is installed
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the "WWE Network" Channel from the Roku menu
custom_expected: THEN the "WWE Network" will open successfully

title: Verify: The WWE Network can be accessed while the Roku is connected using a wired connection
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Roku device
AND the Roku device is currently connected to a wired network connection
AND the "WWE Network" channel is installed
custom_steps: WHEN the user selects the "WWE Network" Channel from the Roku menu
custom_expected: THEN the "WWE Network" will open successfully

title: Verify: User is able to navigate the app without being logged in
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the WWE Network has been installed
AND there is no account logged into the app
custom_steps: WHEN the WWE Network channel is accessed
custom_expected:
THEN the app will open to the HOME menu

AND the following sections will be visible from the HOME menu: 

- On Now
- Featured
- Schedule
- Shows
- Collections
- Recommended 
- Search
- Sign In

AND all sections can be entered.

title: Verify: User is blocked from playing content when not logged in
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the WWE Network app has been accessed
AND there is no account logged into the app
custom_steps:
WHEN the app directs to a section with applicable playable content
AND the app directs to a springboard launch page
AND the WATCH NOW button is clicked
custom_expected:
THEN an access gate page appears
AND a SUBSCRIBER SIGN IN button is visible on the page.

title: Verify: User will NOT be blocked from playing content if they were previously logged in
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has setup their Roku device
AND the Roku device is currently connected to an Internet connection
AND the "WWE Network" channel is installed
AND we have already logged into the WWE Network with an account
custom_steps: WHEN we access the WWE Network channel from the main Roku screen
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be brought to the Home screen
AND the following sections will be visible 
- On Now
- Featured
- Continue Watching
- Watchlist 
- Schedule 
- Shows
- Collections
- Recommended 
- Search 
- Parental Controls: <OFF/ON>
- My Account 
AND can select and launch content from any section without being blocked (unless PCON is set to ON and M rated content is selected to play)

title: Sign In: Verify Login message opens after clicking Sign In
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the WWE Network channel has been installed
AND there is no account logged into the app
AND the app has been opened
custom_steps:
WHEN navigating through the HOME menu
AND activating the SIGN IN section
custom_expected:
THEN the app directs to the virtual keyboard screen
And the text in the virtual keyboard displays as Enter WWE Network User Name
AND Buttons for OK and Cancel are present at the bottom of the screen.

title: Sign in: Verify Login success
custom_preconds:
GIVEN there is no account logged in to the app
AND the app has been activated
AND the SIGN IN section on the Home screen has been accessed
custom_steps:
WHEN the virtual keyboard appears
AND a valid WWE Network User Name is inputted > OK
AND a valid password is inputted > OK
custom_expected:
THEN the credentials will be accepted 
AND the app will be redirected to the WWE Network Home Screen

title: Sign In: Verify Login failed
refs: FInd out if error message will include Forget Password info
custom_preconds:
GIVEN there is no account logged in to the app
AND the app has been activated
AND the SIGN IN section on the Home screen has been accessed
custom_steps:
WHEN the virtual keyboard screen appears
AND either an invalid WWE Network User Name  is entered> OK
OR an invalid password is entered > OK
custom_expected:
THEN an error message will appear
AND the text displayed will read: 

"EMAIL OR PASSWORD NOT RECOGNIZED 
Remember, password is case-sensitive"

title: Sign In: Verify "invalid username" text appears after clicking OK without inputting any text
custom_preconds:
GIVEN there is no account logged in to the app
AND the app has been activated
AND the SIGN IN section on the Home screen has been accessed
custom_steps:
WHEN the virtual keyboard screen appears
AND click OK without inputting any text at the Enter WWE Network User Name prompt
custom_expected: THEN the text on the virtual keyboard will update to display "Invalid username"

title: On Now: Verify signing into app via Watch Now screen of the On Now program launches On Now program in progress
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the app is on the HOME screen
AND no account is signed into the app
custom_steps:
WHEN the ON NOW section is activated

AND the Subscriber Sign In button is clicked

AND a valid password is entered > OK
custom_expected:
THEN the parental advisory bumper will play
AND the ON NOW program will be joined in progress

please note: signing in and viewing the ON NOW program in this manner should ALWAYS join the program in progress, even in the event the account has the VOD of the ON NOW program bookmarked on their account.  Entering the live linear in progress should always take priority.

custom_expected: THEN the ON NOW section will properly update with the EPG schedule

AND playback is entered in progress of the Watch Now Program
AND the BACK button is pressed to exit playback
custom_expected:
THEN the app returns to the Details/Springboard page of the ON NOW program
AND the buttons are displayed as:

- Resume
- Watch from Beginning
- <Add/Remove> To Watchlist

custom_expected:

1. Continue Watching

title: Verify enabling parental controls will hide (yet preserve) restricted content from User's Continue Watching list in Home Carousel
custom_preconds: Test account should be set with parental controls OFF and ONLY ONE TV-14 or higher rated item in Continue Watching.
custom_steps:
1. Confirm TV-14 or higher item appear in Continue Watching carousel thumb.
2. Quit app.
3. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls ON" and save settings.
4. Relaunch Roku app.
5. Confirm TV-14 or higher Continue Watching carousel item does not appear.
6. Quit app.
7. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls OFF" and save settings.
8. Relaunch Roku app.
9. Confirm TV-14 or higher Continue Watching carousel item appears as expected as seen in step 1.
custom_expected: Enabling parental controls will hide restricted content from User's Continue Watching on Home Carousel and disabling enabling parental controls will reveal the same content.

title: Verify enabling parental controls will hide (yet preserve) restricted content from User's Watchlist in Home Carousel
custom_preconds: Test account should be set with parental controls OFF and ONLY ONE TV-14 or higher rated item in Watchlist.
custom_steps:
1. Confirm TV-14 or higher item appears in Watchlist carousel thumb.
2. Quit app.
3. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls ON" and save settings.
4. Relaunch Roku app.
5. Confirm TV-14 or higher Watchlist carousel item does not appear.
6. Quit app.
7. Through user account (via WWE Network site) change account to "Parental Controls OFF" and save settings.
8. Relaunch Roku app.
9. Confirm TV-14 or higher Watchlist carousel item appears as expected as seen in step 1.
custom_expected: Enabling parental controls will hide restricted content from User's Watchlist on Home Carousel and disabling enabling parental controls will reveal the same content.

title: Verify populated Watchlists and Continue Watching lists are shown in Home Carousel
Focus remains on last asset that was navigated to after exiting back from the Details view to Carousel view
custom_preconds:
GIVEN there are a minimum of three assets in the Watchlist/Continue Watching sections 
AND the app is on the details page of an asset in either the Watchlist/ Continue Watching section
custom_steps:
WHEN the left/right button of the remote control is used to scroll to the details page of a different asset
AND with this new asset's detail page on screen the BACK button is used to exit back to Carousel view
custom_expected:
THEN the focus remains on this last asset that was highlighted. 



note: this has been flagged by Roku in the past and should always be checked for on any of our apps that go into Roku Certification

for reference:https://jira.mlbam.com/browse/WWEROKU-113

title: Post Play: Verify Post Play screen appears once playback concludes in Watchlist/ Continue Watching

custom_steps: WHEN playback of the asset reaches it conclusion (this can be done FF to the end)

AND the app enters playback of that particular asset from the Watchlist/Continue Watching section
custom_steps: WHEN the playback for the asset reaches its conclusion
custom_expected: THEN the Live Linear Post Play screen appears

title: Post Play: Verify Auto Play Next Post Play screen appears

GIVEN there is an asset in the Continue Watching/ Watchlist
AND this asset is NOT the last asset in that particular show/series/collection
AND the app is in playback of that asset from the Continue Watching/Watchlist menu
custom_steps: WHEN playback reaches its conclusion
custom_expected:

AND there is a countdown timer

title: Post Play: Verify on Auto-Play Next Post Play screen that once timer clocks down the next episode starts automatically
custom_preconds:
GIVEN an asset that is in the Watchlist/Continue Watching section is not the last asset of that series/show/collection
AND that asset is in playback
custom_steps:
WHEN playback reaches its conclusion
AND the Auto Play Next Post Play screen appears
AND the countdown timer clocks down to zero
custom_expected:
THEN the next episode in that show/series/collection will start to play automatically

please note: this feature remains a bit 'rough' in some cases, so it may not always be the next sequential episode in the series/show/collection.  The most important item here is that Auto-play from one asset to another works.  

If it seems there are some assets that play in a random order this is most likely a COPS issue, not an app issue.

title: Post Play: Verify clicking More Episodes button opens up carousel of additional episodes

AND the More Episodes button is clicked
custom_expected:

custom_preconds:

AND the the app enters/exits playback from the Live Linear or Auto-Play episode

Verify: "Generic Catchall" message for blacked out content
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has launched the app
AND successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account
custom_steps:
WHEN the user attempts to access a VOD
AND the content is blacked out
AND the user is in a blacked out location
AND the blacked out content's HEADLINE and/or SHOW_NAME are unknown

Test ALL entry points:
- Network Home Screen
- Show page
- Schedule
- Search > "Most Popular"
- Watchlist
- (TBD-needs confirmation) Continue Watching (this should not be possible to get a blacked out content in the CW list, but if someone moved to a blackout country after creating a CW list it could happen)
custom_expected:
THEN the user will receive the message below
AND the asset will NOT play
AND the user will remain on the page they started on.

*Content Unavailable*
*This episode is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout.*

AND a Back button will be below the body of the message.

WHEN the Back button is selected
THEN the message will hide 
AND the user will be returned to the page from where the video launch was attempted from.

title: Scenario: User is already in live stream when blacked-out content starts to air
custom_preconds:
Given the user has launched the app
And successfully logged into the WWE Network with an entitled account
And has launched the linear stream when the content had no blackout restrictions
custom_steps:
When the program transitions to either a blacked out episode in a series
OR a blacked out live PPV event
OR a blacked out piece of content where the TITLE and the SHOW_NAME are unknown
AND the user is in a blacked out location
(Verify all scenarios)
custom_expected:
Then the video playback will stop; video/audio will not be observed/heard
AND the user will receive one of the following messages:
Episodes in a Series:
"Content Unavailable
This episode of SHOW_NAME  is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."

PPV Live Events: 
"Content Unavailable
TITLE is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."
     
Generic Catchall:
"Content Unavailable
This episode is currently not available in your area. For more information on WWE Network blackout rules, visit wwe.com/blackout."
     
AND an OK button will be below the body of the message.

WHEN the OK button is selected
THEN the message will hide and the user will be returned to where the video was launched from (WWE 'Home' view or 'Schedule > Today' depending on where the content was accessed from).


*NOTE: Some developers are noting that the expected in this case is to always show the Generic Message, confirmation has not been received.*

Generic Catchall:
"Content Unavailable

AND a Back button will be below the body of the message.

WHEN the Back button is selected
THEN the message will hide 
AND the WWE Home screen will be displayed.
